data.note: In the year to the end of September 2015, the government spent GHS 115.40m on poverty-focused energy sector activities, including rural electrification. Total expenditure on the energy sector over the same period was GHS 158.70m.
data.name: Rural electrification budget

data.note: The figure will be dependent on the pre-existing grid infrastructure and location. In the North, there is a greater demand for communities to be electrified by off-grid technology and here costs are higher at $2,397 per household. Communities in the south have better access to the existing grid and thus have lower costs of connection.
data.name: New connection cost
